marklogic.body: Part of why yellow Fever is such a problem is that there is antibody dependent enhancement of immune reaction to the virus, so those that have been infected before or infants with circulating maternal antibodies have more severe immune and hemorrhagic reactions to the yellow Fever virus if they are reinfected by an infected mosquito bite.Â Yellow Fever used to have outbreaks as far north as Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and insecticides helped to kill Off the infected mosquitoes and stop that from happening.Â Spread of viruses (arboviruses) carried in mosquitoes is aided by shipping old tires that have water carrying the mosquito larvae.Â Also DDT is extremely effective against the mosquitoes, so disuse has increased mosquito populations.Â Part of why West Nile virus has an increase in the fall is that the mosquitoes feed on warm-blooded migrating birds and when they leave the area, the mosquitoes feed on humans, and the infection rate increases.
